article_title: Longmont police: Teen arrested, 2 summonsed after curfew violation
article_text:
LONGMONT

One teen was arrested and two were issued summons Friday after they were contacted at 3:11 a.m. for violating curfew and found to be under the influence of toxic vapors, police said. They also were suspected of shoplifting The teens were transported to the hospital for evaluation. A 16-year-old girl was arrested on suspicion of possession of more than two stolen credit cards, theft, obstruction and abuse of toxic vapors. A 14-year-old boy and a 14-year-old girl wer issued summons on suspicion of violating curfew, theft and abuse of toxic vapors, police said.

A woman was issued a summons Friday on the 1100 block of Ken Pratt Boulevard on suspicion of indecent exposure and theft, police said.

A man was arrested on suspicion of third-degree assault and domestic violence at about 3:32 a.m. Friday on the 2200 block of 14th Avenue, police said.
